# MTLCounterSet

**Protocol**

A collection of individual counters a GPU device supports for a counter set.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol MTLCounterSet : NSObjectProtocol, Sendable
```

## Overview

You can determine which counter sets a GPU supports by checking an [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDevice] instance’s [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDevice/counterSets] property. A counter set’s [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCounterSet/name] property typically matches one of the common counter set names that [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCommonCounterSet] defines. Check whether a GPU device supports a specific counter by comparing elements of the [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCounterSet/counters] property with a counter’s common name that [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCommonCounter] defines.



For more information, see [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/confirming-which-counters-and-counter-sets-a-gpu-supports].

## Identifying a counter set

- **name**: The name of the GPU’s counter set instance.

## Checking which counters a GPU supports

- **counters**: An array of the counter instances a GPU device supports.

## Counters and counter sets

- **Confirming which counters and counter sets a GPU supports**: Check whether a GPU produces the runtime performance data you want to sample.
- **MTLCommonCounterSet**: The name of a specific counter set that a GPU device can support.
- **MTLCounter**: An individual counter a GPU device lists within one of its counter sets.
- **MTLCommonCounter**: The name of a specific counter that can appear in a GPU device’s counter sets.

## Inherits From

- NSObjectProtocol
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
